text:
Patient Discharge Notes:

Patient: Yahya Hval 
DOB: December 18, 1945 
SSN: 275 79 2454
Contact: +1 (222) 0942-581 
Place of Birth: Gangstadhaugen 

Admission Notes:
Mr. Hval was admitted to Sykehuset i Vestfold HF, Psykisk helse - voksne, Tønsberg - Granli on August 22, 2012. He has a primary diagnosis code I1311 - Hypertensive heart and chronic kidney disease without heart failure.

In the evaluation of vital signs, Mr. Hval (77 years old) presented with an elevated core temperature. Despite the feverish state, there were no signs of dehydration. The patient had reduced mobility, along with a slowed heart rate indicated by the cardiogram. During the physical examination, he reported feeling mild discomfort which was managed with analgesics. 

A further assessment showed a low blood pressure and slow breathing rate. This was carefully monitored and managed through a combination of medication and lifestyle recommendations. 

Treatment was mainly supportive, focusing on managing symptoms and improving his quality of life. Despite his underlying conditions, Mr. Hval responded well to treatment.

Discharged Condition: 
Upon discharge, Mr. Hval's condition had significantly improved. He was recommended to continue with his medication schedule and advised on potential lifestyle modifications in response to his diagnosed conditions.

Recommended Follow Up: 
Mr. Hval is recommended to return for scheduled follow-up appointments with his primary care physician and specialists to manage his health conditions. 

Success to the interdisciplinary approach, Mr. Hval, despite his diagnosis, has shown promising improvement and resilience in his health. He is being discharged in good stable condition. His diligence and cooperation were noted and are bound to contribute significantly to his recovery journey.

Prepared by:
[Physician's Name]
[Date]

Discharge Summary

Patient Name: Arvin Tvedten
Date of Birth: January 14. 1973
Age: 50 years old
Contact Number: 8856462055
Social Security Number: 931-09-7025
Location of Birth: Varhaugvika
 
Admission Details: 
October 25. 2017 admitted to the UNN, Narvik Sykehus - Radiologi with primary diagnosis code "S06355D Traumatic hemorrhage of left cerebrum with loss of consciousness greater than 24 hours with return to pre-existing conscious level". At the time of admission, patient showed signs of shallow breathing, full mobility, moderate pain, a slowed heart rate, high blood pressure, low core temperature, and clear signs of dehydration. 

Discharge Status:
Arvin responded well to treatment and rehabilitation regimen during his hospital stay, showcasing significant improvement. He has also been advised to maintain regular follow-ups for a re-evaluation to ensure his continued recovery.

Prescribed Medication:
Medication and therapies are prescribed as per the treatment plan discussed. Patient is also advised for home-based physical exercises to maintain mobility.

Next Appointment:
Patient is advised to continue regular follow-ups with the assigned healthcare team. For any health changes or emergencies, immediate contact with the healthcare unit is advised.

Physician's Signature:
_____________________

text:
Discharge Note:

Patient: Patrick Marken
43 years old.
Social Security Number: 365-63-2438
Phone: (438) 3496-678
Location of Birth: Mogrenda
Birthdate: February 24, 1980

Admission Date: May 05, 2016 

Healthcare Provider: Aleris Sykehus Solsiden 

Recommended Discharge: Patrick Marken was admitted with a primary diagnosis of T433X2S Poisoning by phenothiazine antipsychotics and neuroleptics, with consistent findings including regular pulse, low blood pressure, and slow breathing upon admission. The patient did not present with signs of dehydration or elevated core temperature. He also reported experiencing mild pain, but retained full mobility. Considering these factors, a discharge plan will be convened with the primary care physician. Regular follow-up and continued monitoring of symptoms and blood pressure are highly recommended. 

This note has been carefully curated to reflect all major clinical findings while maintaining patient confidentiality as per HIPAA guidelines. The patient's health status will be continually monitored.

text:
Patient Name: Brynjar Fredheim

Age: 49 years

Date of Admission: January 10, 2018

Hospital: Sørlandet sykehus, ABUP Arendal

Date of Birth: April 03, 1974

Place of Birth: Alternes

Contact number: (716) 7588-990

Social Security Number: 981935046

Primary diagnosis code: S61551S Open bite of right wrist

Clinical Summary:

At the time of admission, the patient presented with moderate pain following an injury to the right wrist. The patient also showed some signs of dehydration, with reports of reduced mobility, and slow pulse. Also observed was shallow breathing, indicating potential respiratory distress. Vital signs recorded an unremarkable blood pressure, but low core temperature. The patient's status has been continuously monitored to manage and mitigate any potential risk.

Recommendations upon discharge:

Further follow-ups and appropriate therapies are recommended for continued recovery and managing the open bite of the right wrist. The patient is also advised to maintain proper hydration and nutrition. Breath exercises could be beneficial for improving respiratory wellness. The patient must reach out for immediate medical help in case of any complications.

(Signed) Doctor's name and Title

text:
Discharge Note:

Patient: Svein-Erik Riaz
23 years old

SSN: 993167144

Phone: +1 (653) 5182-622

DOB: May 03. 2000

Birthplace: Bjerkøya

Admitted: August 21. 2013 to Sykehuset Innlandet, BUP Oppland, poliklinikk Lillehammer

Diagnosis: V652XXA Person on outside of heavy transport vehicle injured in collision with railway train or railway vehicle in nontraffic accident

Admission findings: At admission, the patient reported experiencing light pain, but maintained full mobility. There were notable alterations in respiratory and cardiovascular rates, namely, slow breathing, elevated blood pressure, and a quick pulse. There were no signs of dehydration, however, the patient's core temperature was found to be low.

Treatment plan: The patient was monitored continuously with focus on cardiovascular function, respiration, and body temperature. His blood pressure, respiration rate, pulse, and core temperature were regularly checked and appropriate measures were taken to stabilise these readings. Instructions were given to the patient about post-accident care and symptoms to keep an eye on.

Discharge status: Stable. Returns home with a scheduled follow-up evaluation.

For further assistance, feel free to contact the Sykehuset Innlandet, BUP Oppland, poliklinikk Lillehammer.

Dr. (Physician's name)

Yasin Rønhovde, 23 years old, was admitted to Akershus universitetssykehus, ARA, Follo døgn on March 31, 2022. The primary diagnosis at the time of admission was "S42461S - Displaced fracture of medial condyle of right humerus". 

Upon admission, Yasin exhibited several symptoms including signs of dehydration, an elevated heart rate, full mobility, regular breathing, and high blood pressure, despite reporting no pain. He also had a lower than normal core body temperature.

Yasin was born in Stavsjø on January 25, 2000. His contact number is +1 (488) 4973-389 and Social Security Number is 654 71 5028.

Kindly follow up with your primary healthcare provider for a follow-up appointment. Stay hydrated, and monitor your temperature regularly. Should you experience any discomfort, or your symptoms persist or worsen, please do not hesitate to seek immediate medical attention.

text:
Sykehuset Innlandet, DPS Elverum-Hamar, poliklinikk Hamar Discharge Note

Patient Name: Ahmad Mørk

Patient Date of Birth: September 13, 1957 (65 years old)

Admission Date: May 10. 2019

Primary Diagnosis : S72354P Nondisplaced comminuted fracture of shaft of right femur

Contact Information: 
Telephone: +1 (903) 9950-644 
Social Security : 006 40 0179

Place of Birth: Sakshaug 

Findings:

Upon admission, the patient presented with stable vital signs with regards to breathing which was regular. However, the heart rate was noted to be slowed, and blood pressure was elevated which necessitated monitoring. The patient's core temperature was elevated indicating a possible systemic response to the injury.  His mobility was compromised due to the fracture of the right femur.

Pain was reported as mild, but impaired mobility and other systemic responses indicated a level of physical distress. Dehydration signs were also present on admission which indicate that the patient had not been adequately hydrating.

Discharge Notes:

The patient’s mobility may remain compromised until recovery and therefore necessitates appropriate care and physical therapy. Encourage hydration and monitor vitals until stabilized. Pain management should be continued as per patient's comfort and need.

The patient Ahmad Mørk has been discharged in stable condition with instructions for home care and follow-up recommendations. Do not hesitate to contact if any concerns or questions arise.

This document serves as a comprehensive discharge note outlining patient stay, medical observations and recommended aftercare.

text:
Patient Name: <Grzegorz >  Nævdal 
Age: 43 years old
Date of birth: August 05. 1980
Place of birth: Pollestad
Contact Information: +1 (158) 4845-280
Social Security Number: 654-07-8191

Primary Diagnosis: T24712D Corrosion of third degree of left thigh

Details: 
Grzegorz Nævdal was admitted to the Sykehuset Innlandet, DPS Gjøvik, poliklinikk Valdres on August 29. 2020. He displayed moderate pain in the left thigh due to a third-degree corrosion injury. Vital signs showed ordinary blood pressure and regular pulse, but there were signs of dehydration, visualized by shallow breathing and a lower than average core temperature. The patient exhibited full mobility. 

Plan: 
Water and electrolyte replacement to address dehydration. Regular monitoring of vital signs. Cleaning, debridement, and dressing of the corrosion wound on the left thigh to prevent infection and promote healing. Pain management to keep the patient comfortable.

Rest of discharge plan to be determined according to the patient's progress in the coming days. 

Please advise Grzegorz Nævdal to follow all post-discharge instructions and to make appropriate follow-up appointments.

Patient Discharge Note: 

This is to certify that Jørn Hinna, born on May 23. 2007 at Knarvik, with the 627735057, has been discharged following his admission at Vestre Viken, Bærum sykehus, Røntgen on April 07. 2015. The patient's contact can be made via the <Phone_Number>(104) 4704-745<Phone_Number>.

The patient was admitted with the primary diagnosis code "S72121P Displaced fracture of lesser trochanter of right femur". At the time of admission, the patient of 16 years showed symptoms of slow pulse, shallow breathing, some signs of dehydration, low core temperature, light pain, full mobility and low blood pressure. 

Post-procedure, all vital parameters have returned to normal levels and the patient shows signs of substantial recovery ready for discharge.

The patient will need to continue observation and check-ups with a local health provider as recommended. Daily activities could be resumed gradually and participation in strenuous or trauma-risk activities must be avoided. 

The patient has been instructed about the need for care and nutrition to assist recovery.

Primary Diagnosis: Displaced fracture of lesser trochanter of right femur.

<Mihai was born in <Fedje on <December 03. 2003.

Diagnosis:

The primary diagnosis was "O0732 Renal failure following failed attempted termination of pregnancy". 

Observations on Admission:

At the time of admission, the patient had an elevated core temperature and clear signs of dehydration, as well as a regular pulse and elevated blood pressure. Mobility was reduced and moderate pain was observed, although breathing remained regular.

Discharge Note:

Patient: Fredrick Takvam
DOB: <Date>Moltustranda on May 20. 1976</Date>
Age: 47 years old 
Phone Number: (007) 3702-903 
Social Security Number: 388 52 3895 

Admission Details:
Fredrick Takvam was admitted to Sykehuset Østfold, Poliklinikk rus og avhengighetsbehandling, Sarpsborg on May 13, 2016. The principal diagnosis code is "S72351G – Displaced comminuted fracture of shaft of right femur". 

Presenting Symptoms:
At the time of admission, patient had no pain, shallow breathing, elevated blood pressure, ordinary body temperature, slowed heart rate, and reduced mobility. There were no signs of dehydration.

Discharge Summary:
Fredrick has made notable recovery during his stay, showing progressive improvement in his breathing, blood pressure, heart rate, and mobility. Follow-up and physiotherapy sessions are advised.

For further queries, feel free to contact Sykehuset Østfold, Poliklinikk rus og avhengighetsbehandling, Sarpsborg at (007) 3702-903.

text:
Patient Discharge Note

Patient Name: Tor Mork
Age: 59
Social Security Number: 338-77-2658
Phone Number: 6872385235
Birth Place and Date: Kvål, January 30. 1964

Hospital: Helse Stavanger, Sandnes DPS, Varatun
Admission Date: June 02. 2013

Primary Diagnosis: V2551XS Electric (assisted) bicycle passenger injured in a collision with a railway train or railway vehicle in a traffic accident.

Findings on Admission: 
The patient exhibited shallow breathing, noticeable rigidity in his speech and body language indicated full mobility. The patient was reporting light pain. Vital signs showed a regular pulse and high blood pressure. Testing indicated clear signs of dehydration, despite body temperature being within the normal range.

Progress and Condition at Discharge: 
The patient's dehydration was treated effectively during the stay. His high blood pressure was managed and monitored closely. Breathing normalized and pain was managed successfully throughout the hospitalization period.

Discharge Instructions: 
The patient is instructed to continue to monitor his blood pressure and seek medical help if he experiences pain, shortness of breath or any other concerning symptoms. A follow-up appointment will be scheduled for further evaluation and ongoing blood pressure management.

This note was prepared by the discharging doctor at the Helse Stavanger, Sandnes DPS, Varatun.

Please call us at 6872385235 if you have any questions concerning the patient's condition or the instructions given.

text:
Discharge Note:
-----------------------

Patient: Alexandru Lea 
DOB: October 04. 2009
Address: Larsnes
Contact: +1 (230) 9326-613
SSN: 232-56-6398

Admission Details:
------------------------

Alexandru Lea, 13 years old, was admitted to Russeksjonen, UNN Narvik on December 31. 2017 with the primary diagnosis code "T442X2A Poisoning by ganglionic blocking drugs". 

Patient Presentation:
------------------------

At the time of admission, the patient had the following symptoms: 

-Slowed heart rate
-No pain
-High blood pressure
-Dehydration 
-Ordinary body temperature
-Reduced mobility 
-Standard breathing rate

These signs and symptoms may be linked to the influence of the ganglionic blocking drugs.

Please provide the necessary follow-ups and recommendations for the next steps on in-home care, medication usage guidance, and lifestyle changes.

This discharge summary has been reviewed and is found accurate to the medical records.

End of Report.

text:
Patient: Snorre Skeie.

Age: 73 years old. 

Admission Details: 

The patient was admitted with a primary diagnosis code "S0005XA Superficial foreign body of scalp" to the Helse Stavanger, Ruspoliklinikk ung Sandnes (RuPo Sandnes) on December 07, 2022. 

Clinical Findings at Admission: 

The patient had moderate pain accompanied by shallow breathing. Despite being fully mobile, the patient was exhibiting clear signs of dehydration along with a high blood pressure reading and a low core temperature. His pulse, however, was regular. 

Personal Information: 

The patient was born in Honningsvåg on January 12, 1950. 
The patient's phone number is (816) 8567-759. 
The patient's social security number is 368329176. 

Discharge Summary: 

The patient has made good progress and is now ready for discharge. Instructions on post-discharge care and follow-up appointments have been provided. Regular monitoring of vital signs is recommended. 

Please, ensure that the patient receives the appropriate discharge medication, follow-up instructions, and has arranged for transportation home. 

This report prepared by: 

Dr. J. Andersen, 
Specialist.

Patient Information:
Hallstein Netland
DOB: April 19, 1999
Born in: Kaland
SSN: 880981678
Phone: 7432700001
Age: 24 Years 

Admission details: Hallstein was admitted on October 15, 2015 with the primary diagnosis of S82251P - Displaced comminuted fracture of shaft of right tibia.

Physical Exam at Admission:
The patient had regular body temperature and pulse, slow breathing, moderate pain in the leg, and reduced mobility. There were some signs of dehydration and high blood pressure was noted. 

Plan:
Continue supportive care for pain management and hydration. Discuss the case with an orthopedic surgeon for further management of the tibia fracture.

By,
Attending Physician
